title: Arrest made in Bullitt County bomb threat
text: BULLITT COUNTY, KY (WAVE) – A man has been arrested in connection to a bomb threat that caused the evacuation of two courthouses in Shepherdsville, according to Bullitt County Sheriff's Office. Robert Pronovost, 30, of Shepherdsville, Kentucky, was taken into custody at 8:45 p.m. Monday. Investigators said around 200 people were evacuated from the Bullitt County Courthouse and the adjacent Bullitt County Judicial Center Monday morning after a phone call to Bullitt County 911 stated there were explosive devices in the area. [PREVIOUS STORY: All clear given after bomb threat forces evacuation of 2 courthouses] The Bullitt County Sheriff's Office, Shepherdsville Police, Bullitt County Emergency Management Agency and the Shepherdsville Fire Department went to investigate the threat. Two K-9s were sent into search the buildings and officials determined the area was clear around 2 p.m. The Bullitt County Sheriff's Office said Pronovost admitted making the bomb threat in order to avoid going to jail on a case scheduled for Monday afternoon. Pronovost is being held in the Bullitt County Corrections Department. Copyright 2013 WAVE 3 News. All rights reserved.
